meta.scope: Website Builder + SEO + AEO + GEO + Brand + UX + CRO + AI-Readiness + Security + Performance
meta.usage: TWO MODES: (1) FRESH BUILD: Give domain + category + credentials → AI builds complete website, uploads, and configures everything. (2) AUDIT MODE: Give existing URL → AI runs full 360 audit + auto-fix.
meta.author: LeadHorizon AI Audit System

0_website_builder_system.label: AI Website Builder System
0_website_builder_system.description: Complete system to build a production-ready website from scratch. User provides: domain, business category, and hosting credentials. AI builds everything.

intake_form.description: Questions AI must ask user before building

tagline.question: Tagline ya one-liner?
tagline.example: Data-Driven Growth for Real Estate Developers

logo_path.question: Logo file ka path? (ya AI generate kare?)

category_templates.description: Pre-built configurations per business category. AI uses these to generate page structure, content tone, color scheme, sections, CTAs, schema type, and keywords.

real_estate_project.label: Real Estate Project / Property Landing Page

file_structure.description: Files AI will generate for every website

files.index.html: Main landing page with all sections, meta tags, schema, OG tags
files.style.css: Complete responsive CSS with animations, mobile-first design
files.script.js: Counter animations, mobile menu, scroll effects, form validation, modals, exit intent, cookie consent
files.contact.html: Contact page with form, map, phone, email, WhatsApp
files.blog.html: Blog listing page with featured post + grid
files.blog/post-1.html: First blog post (SEO-optimized, 1500+ words, Article schema)
files.privacy-policy.html: Auto-generated privacy policy customized for business
files.faq.html: FAQ page with FAQPage schema (5-10 Q&As based on category)
files.thankyou.html: Thank you page for form conversion tracking
files.404.html: Custom 404 page with navigation back to homepage
files.sitemap.xml: XML sitemap with all pages, lastmod, priority, changefreq
files.robots.txt: robots.txt with sitemap reference, crawler rules
files..htaccess: Security headers, GZIP, caching, redirects, error pages
files.favicon.svg: SVG favicon auto-generated from business name initials
files.og-image.jpg: Open Graph image (1200x630) with brand name + tagline
files.logo.png: Simple text-based logo if user doesn't provide one
files.llms.txt: AI crawler info file with structured business data

page_blueprint.description: Exact HTML structure AI will follow for index.html
head_section: title tag (Primary Keyword | Brand Name) - max 60 chars
meta description - max 160 chars with CTA
OG tags (type, title, description, url, image, site_name, locale)
Twitter card tags (card, title, description, image)
main CSS link with version query

cookie_banner.behavior: Show after 2s if not accepted. Store in localStorage.

header.behavior: Fixed position, shrink on scroll, mobile responsive

hero.rules: H1 must contain primary keyword. Subtitle explains value prop. Background image preloaded as WebP.

stats_bar.rules: Show real values as default (not 0). JS animates from 0 to target on scroll.

client_logos.rules: All logos must have descriptive alt text with 'Client' keyword. width/height set.

services.rules: Each service links to dedicated service page if it exists.

projects_portfolio.rules: Show real metrics. Live status indicator with pulse animation.

testimonials.rules: Use real or realistic testimonials. Include company name.

case_studies.rules: Include specific numbers: leads, conversion rate, revenue, ROI.

about.rules: Mention years, location, team size. Include image with WebP + JPEG fallback.

cta_section.rules: High contrast background. Single clear CTA.

blog_preview.rules: Each card links to individual blog post URL, NOT blog.html.

faq_section.rules: Must match FAQPage schema exactly. Include target keywords in questions.

footer.rules: Phone wrapped in tel: link. Email in mailto: link. Copyright shows current year.

whatsapp_float.rules: Links to wa.me/[number]. Bottom-right position. z-index above all.

elements: form (name, phone, email, location, message, submit)
contact_modal.rules: Triggered by all CTA buttons with class 'open-contact-form'. Form submits to query.php or API.

exit_intent_popup.rules: Show once per session. Trigger on mouse exit (desktop) or 30s timeout (mobile).

architecture.variables: All colors, fonts, shadows, transitions, radius in :root CSS variables
architecture.animations: fade-in on scroll (IntersectionObserver), counter, pulse, float

design_rules: Buttons: min 48px height, 16px+ font, rounded corners
Sections: alternate between white and light-bg background
Mobile: hamburger menu, single column grids, smaller fonts

js_system.description: JavaScript features to include in every website
features: Counter animation (animate from 0 to data-target on scroll)
Contact modal (open/close, click outside to close, Escape key)
Exit intent popup (mouseout top, mobile 30s timeout, session storage)
Smooth scroll for anchor links (offset by header height)
Form validation (mobile number 10+ digits, email format)
Lazy loading fallback for older browsers
rules: All JS in single script.js file
Use defer attribute on script tag

content_generation.description: How AI generates content for each section
rules: Primary keyword in H1, first 100 words, and 2-3 H2s
Location name in title, meta description, H1, and about section
Each section has minimum 50-100 words of meaningful content
CTAs use benefit-driven language, not generic 'Submit' or 'Click Here'
Stats use realistic but impressive numbers based on category
Testimonials use Indian names for Indian businesses, realistic designations
FAQ answers are 40-80 words each, direct and factual
Blog posts are 1500+ words with proper heading hierarchy
Privacy policy and terms are legally accurate for Indian businesses

per_post.images: 3-4 relevant Unsplash images with alt text
per_post.meta: Unique title (60 chars) + description (160 chars) + OG + Twitter

blog_post_structure.topic_selection: Based on category target_keywords. Mix of how-to, guide, listicle, case study.

steps: 1. Generate all files locally in ~/Desktop/[ProjectName]/ folder
2. Verify all HTML validates (no unclosed tags, proper nesting)
3. Connect to hosting via SSH/FTP using provided credentials
4. Find public_html or web root directory
5. Backup existing files (if any) to /backup/ folder on server
6. Upload all files via SCP/FTP
7. Verify .htaccess is uploaded as hidden file
8. Test homepage loads correctly via WebFetch
9. Test all pages load (contact, blog, privacy, terms, 404)
10. Verify HTTPS redirect works
11. Verify GZIP compression active
12. Submit sitemap to Google Search Console (if GSC credentials available)
13. Request indexing for homepage and key pages
14. Run full 360 SEO audit checklist against live site
15. Generate final report for user

post_deployment_seo.description: SEO tasks to run immediately after deployment
steps: Submit sitemap.xml to Google Search Console
Request indexing for all important pages
Verify robots.txt is accessible
Test schema markup on Google Rich Results Test
Test OG tags on Facebook Sharing Debugger
Run PageSpeed Insights and note score
Check mobile-friendly test
Verify all internal links work (no 404s)
Test contact form submission
Verify WhatsApp button works
Check cookie consent banner
Test exit intent popup

query_php_template.description: Backend form handler template (PHP for shared hosting)
features: Receive form data (name, mobile, email, location, query)
Send email notification to business owner
Save lead to CSV file as backup
Rate limiting (max 5 submissions per IP per hour)

1_technical_seo.label: Technical SEO
1_technical_seo.description: Foundation-level technical checks that affect crawling, indexing, and ranking.

1_01_https.check: Site uses HTTPS with valid SSL certificate
1_01_https.how_to_fix: Install SSL via hosting panel or Cloudflare. Add 301 redirect HTTP → HTTPS in .htaccess.

1_02_www_redirect.check: www and non-www versions redirect to one canonical version (no duplicate)
1_02_www_redirect.how_to_fix: Add RewriteRule in .htaccess to force www → non-www or vice versa.

1_03_robots_txt.check: robots.txt exists, is accessible, and allows crawling of important pages
1_03_robots_txt.how_to_fix: Create /robots.txt with User-agent: * Allow: / and Sitemap reference.

1_04_sitemap_xml.check: XML sitemap exists, lists all important pages, submitted to GSC
1_04_sitemap_xml.how_to_fix: Generate sitemap.xml with all pages, proper lastmod dates, priority, and changefreq. Submit in Google Search Console.

1_05_sitemap_dates.check: Sitemap lastmod dates are accurate and updated when content changes
1_05_sitemap_dates.how_to_fix: Update lastmod to current date whenever page content is modified.

1_06_canonical_tags.check: Every page has a correct rel=canonical tag pointing to itself

1_07_meta_robots.check: All important pages have <meta name='robots' content='index, follow'>
1_07_meta_robots.how_to_fix: Add meta robots tag in <head>. Use noindex only for pages you don't want in search.

1_08_404_page.check: Custom 404 page exists with navigation links back to main pages
1_08_404_page.how_to_fix: Create 404.html with helpful links. Add ErrorDocument 404 /404.html in .htaccess.

1_09_crawl_errors.check: No crawl errors in Google Search Console (404s, 5xx, redirect chains)
1_09_crawl_errors.how_to_fix: Check GSC Coverage report. Fix broken URLs with 301 redirects or content restoration.

1_10_page_speed_mobile.check: Mobile page speed score > 80 on PageSpeed Insights
1_10_page_speed_mobile.how_to_fix: Optimize images (WebP), enable GZIP, add browser caching, defer JS, reduce CSS.

1_11_page_speed_desktop.check: Desktop page speed score > 90 on PageSpeed Insights
1_11_page_speed_desktop.how_to_fix: Same as mobile + preload critical resources, inline critical CSS.

1_12_mobile_friendly.how_to_fix: Add viewport meta tag, use responsive CSS, test on mobile devices.

1_13_viewport_meta.how_to_fix: Add viewport meta tag in <head> of every page.

1_14_charset.check: <meta charset='UTF-8'> is the first tag in <head>
1_14_charset.how_to_fix: Add <meta charset='UTF-8'> as first element inside <head>.

1_15_lang_attribute.how_to_fix: Add lang attribute to <html> tag matching page language.

1_16_hreflang.check: hreflang tags present if site serves multiple languages/regions
1_16_hreflang.how_to_fix: Add <link rel='alternate' hreflang='xx' href='url'> for each language version.

1_17_redirect_chains.how_to_fix: Update old redirects to point directly to final destination URL.

1_18_mixed_content.check: No mixed content (HTTP resources on HTTPS pages)
1_18_mixed_content.how_to_fix: Change all http:// resource URLs to https:// or use protocol-relative //.

1_19_url_structure.check: URLs are clean, lowercase, hyphenated, descriptive (no query strings for main pages)

1_20_trailing_slashes.check: Consistent trailing slash usage (either all with or all without)
1_20_trailing_slashes.how_to_fix: Pick one format and redirect the other via .htaccess.

2_on_page_seo.label: On-Page SEO
2_on_page_seo.description: Content and HTML-level optimization for each page.

2_01_title_tag.check: Every page has a unique, keyword-rich <title> tag (50-60 chars)
2_01_title_tag.how_to_fix: Write unique title: Primary Keyword | Brand Name. Keep under 60 characters.

2_02_meta_description.check: Every page has a unique, compelling meta description (120-160 chars)
2_02_meta_description.how_to_fix: Write action-oriented description with primary keyword and CTA. Under 160 chars.

2_03_h1_tag.check: Every page has exactly ONE H1 tag containing the primary keyword
2_03_h1_tag.how_to_fix: Ensure single H1 per page. Include target keyword naturally.

2_04_heading_hierarchy.check: Heading hierarchy is logical: H1 > H2 > H3 (no skipping levels)
2_04_heading_hierarchy.how_to_fix: Structure content with proper heading nesting. Don't jump from H1 to H3.

2_05_keyword_in_first_100_words.check: Primary keyword appears in the first 100 words of body content
2_05_keyword_in_first_100_words.how_to_fix: Naturally include target keyword early in the page content.

2_06_keyword_density.check: Keyword density is 1-2% (not over-optimized, not missing)
2_06_keyword_density.how_to_fix: Use keyword naturally throughout content. Avoid stuffing. Use LSI keywords.

2_07_image_alt_tags.check: ALL images have descriptive, keyword-relevant alt attributes
2_07_image_alt_tags.how_to_fix: Add alt='Descriptive text about image' to every tag. Include keywords naturally.

2_08_image_dimensions.check: All images have explicit width and height attributes (prevents CLS)
2_08_image_dimensions.how_to_fix: Add width='X' height='Y' to all tags to prevent layout shift.

2_09_image_format.check: Images use modern formats (WebP) with fallbacks (JPEG/PNG)
2_09_image_format.how_to_fix: Use tag with and fallback.

2_10_image_compression.check: Images are compressed (< 100KB for thumbnails, < 300KB for hero images)
2_10_image_compression.how_to_fix: Use tools like TinyPNG, ImageOptim, or squoosh.app to compress images.

2_11_image_lazy_loading.how_to_fix: Add loading='lazy' to all images except hero/LCP image.

2_12_internal_linking.check: Each page has 3-5+ internal links to other relevant pages
2_12_internal_linking.how_to_fix: Link to related services, blog posts, and key pages with descriptive anchor text.

2_13_anchor_text.check: Internal link anchor text is descriptive (not 'click here' or 'read more')
2_13_anchor_text.how_to_fix: Use keyword-rich anchor text: 'SEO for real estate' instead of 'click here'.

2_14_external_links.check: External links open in new tab (target='_blank') with rel='noopener'
2_14_external_links.how_to_fix: Add target='_blank' rel='noopener noreferrer' to external links.

2_15_broken_links.check: No broken internal or external links (all return 200)
2_15_broken_links.how_to_fix: Use a crawler to find broken links. Fix or redirect them.

2_16_content_length.check: Main pages have 800+ words. Blog posts have 1500+ words for SEO value
2_16_content_length.how_to_fix: Expand thin content with valuable, relevant information. Don't pad with fluff.

2_17_content_freshness.check: Content is up-to-date (dates, stats, year references are current)
2_17_content_freshness.how_to_fix: Update copyright year, statistics, and date references to current year.

2_18_no_duplicate_content.check: No duplicate content across pages (each page is unique)
2_18_no_duplicate_content.how_to_fix: Ensure each page has unique content. Use canonical tags for similar pages.

2_19_table_of_contents.check: Long-form content (1500+ words) has a table of contents with jump links
2_19_table_of_contents.how_to_fix: Add TOC with anchor links to H2/H3 sections at the top of long articles.

2_20_favicon.check: Favicon is set (SVG + PNG fallbacks for all devices)

3_structured_data_schema.label: Structured Data / Schema Markup
3_structured_data_schema.description: Schema.org markup for rich snippets and enhanced SERP visibility.

3_01_organization_schema.check: Organization schema with name, url, logo, contactPoint, sameAs (social links)
3_01_organization_schema.how_to_fix: Add Organization JSON-LD in homepage <head> with all business details.

3_02_local_business_schema.check: LocalBusiness schema with address, phone, email, geo, openingHours, priceRange
3_02_local_business_schema.how_to_fix: Add LocalBusiness JSON-LD with complete NAP (Name, Address, Phone) data.

3_03_breadcrumb_schema.check: BreadcrumbList schema on every page showing navigation path
3_03_breadcrumb_schema.how_to_fix: Add BreadcrumbList JSON-LD: Home > Section > Current Page.

3_04_faq_schema.check: FAQPage schema on pages with FAQ content (max 5-10 Q&A)
3_04_faq_schema.how_to_fix: Add FAQPage JSON-LD with Question and Answer pairs from page content.

3_05_article_schema.check: Article/BlogPosting schema on all blog posts with author, datePublished, image
3_05_article_schema.how_to_fix: Add Article JSON-LD with headline, author, datePublished, dateModified, image.

3_06_product_service_schema.check: Service/Product schema on service pages with description and offers
3_06_product_service_schema.how_to_fix: Add Service JSON-LD with name, description, provider, areaServed.

3_07_aggregate_rating.check: AggregateRating schema with ratingValue and reviewCount (if reviews exist)
3_07_aggregate_rating.how_to_fix: Add AggregateRating inside LocalBusiness schema with actual review data.

3_08_review_schema.check: Individual Review schema for testimonials (author, rating, reviewBody)
3_08_review_schema.how_to_fix: Add Review JSON-LD for each testimonial with author name and rating.

3_09_contact_page_schema.how_to_fix: Add ContactPage JSON-LD with name, description, url.

3_10_speakable_schema.check: SpeakableSpecification on key pages for Google Assistant / AI voice search
3_10_speakable_schema.how_to_fix: Add WebPage JSON-LD with speakable.cssSelector targeting key content sections.

3_11_sitelinks_searchbox.check: WebSite schema with SearchAction for sitelinks search box (if applicable)
3_11_sitelinks_searchbox.how_to_fix: Add WebSite JSON-LD with potentialAction SearchAction.

3_12_schema_validation.check: All schema markup validates without errors on Google Rich Results Test

4_open_graph_social.label: Open Graph & Social Meta Tags
4_open_graph_social.description: Meta tags for social sharing (Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, WhatsApp).

4_01_og_type.check: og:type is set (website for homepage, article for blog posts)
4_01_og_type.how_to_fix: Add <meta property='og:type' content='website'> or 'article' for blogs.

4_02_og_title.check: og:title is set on every page (can differ from <title>)

4_03_og_description.check: og:description is set on every page

4_04_og_image.check: og:image is set on every page (1200x630px recommended)
4_04_og_image.how_to_fix: Create og-image.jpg (1200x630px) and add <meta property='og:image' content='url'>.

4_05_og_url.check: og:url matches canonical URL on every page

4_08_twitter_card.check: twitter:card is set on every page (summary_large_image preferred)

4_09_twitter_title.check: twitter:title and twitter:description set on every page
4_09_twitter_title.how_to_fix: Add twitter:title and twitter:description meta tags.

4_10_twitter_image.check: twitter:image is set on every page

4_11_social_preview_test.check: Social sharing preview looks good on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, WhatsApp
4_11_social_preview_test.how_to_fix: Test with Facebook Sharing Debugger, Twitter Card Validator, LinkedIn Post Inspector.

5_google_search_console.label: Google Search Console
5_google_search_console.description: GSC setup, monitoring, and optimization tasks.

5_01_gsc_verified.check: Site is verified in Google Search Console (DNS, HTML tag, or file method)
5_01_gsc_verified.how_to_fix: Add google-site-verification meta tag or upload verification file.

5_02_sitemap_submitted.check: Sitemap.xml is submitted in GSC Sitemaps section
5_02_sitemap_submitted.how_to_fix: GSC > Sitemaps > Add sitemap URL > Submit.

5_03_indexing_requested.check: All important pages are indexed (URL Inspection > Request Indexing)
5_03_indexing_requested.how_to_fix: Use URL Inspection tool for each important page. Click Request Indexing.

5_04_coverage_errors.check: No coverage errors (Excluded, Error pages in Coverage report)
5_04_coverage_errors.how_to_fix: Fix 404s, redirect errors, server errors shown in Coverage report.

5_05_mobile_usability.check: No mobile usability issues in GSC
5_05_mobile_usability.how_to_fix: Fix text too small, clickable elements too close, content wider than screen.

5_06_core_web_vitals.check: Core Web Vitals pass in GSC (LCP < 2.5s, FID < 100ms, CLS < 0.1)
5_06_core_web_vitals.how_to_fix: Optimize LCP (preload hero image), FID (defer JS), CLS (set image dimensions).

5_07_performance_monitoring.check: Monitor clicks, impressions, CTR, position regularly
5_07_performance_monitoring.how_to_fix: Check GSC Performance report weekly. Track keyword rankings.

5_08_search_appearance.check: Rich results appearing for pages with schema markup
5_08_search_appearance.how_to_fix: Check Enhancements section in GSC for FAQ, Breadcrumb rich result status.

6_google_business_profile.label: Google Business Profile (GMB)
6_google_business_profile.description: Local SEO via Google Business Profile optimization.

6_01_gbp_claimed.check: Google Business Profile is claimed and verified
6_01_gbp_claimed.how_to_fix: Go to business.google.com, claim your business, verify via postcard/phone.

6_02_nap_consistent.check: NAP (Name, Address, Phone) is consistent across website, GBP, and all directories
6_02_nap_consistent.how_to_fix: Ensure exact same business name, address, phone on website footer, GBP, and citations.

6_03_gbp_categories.check: Primary and secondary business categories are set correctly
6_03_gbp_categories.how_to_fix: Choose most relevant primary category. Add 3-5 secondary categories.

6_04_gbp_description.check: Business description is keyword-rich and complete (750 chars max)
6_04_gbp_description.how_to_fix: Write compelling description with target keywords and service areas.

6_05_gbp_photos.check: Profile has 10+ quality photos (logo, cover, office, team, work)
6_05_gbp_photos.how_to_fix: Upload high-quality photos of office, team, projects, logo.

6_06_gbp_reviews.check: Business has 10+ reviews with 4.5+ average rating
6_06_gbp_reviews.how_to_fix: Ask satisfied clients to leave Google reviews. Respond to all reviews.

6_07_gbp_posts.check: Regular GBP posts (weekly updates, offers, events)
6_07_gbp_posts.how_to_fix: Post weekly updates about services, offers, or blog content.

6_08_gbp_services.check: All services are listed with descriptions in GBP
6_08_gbp_services.how_to_fix: Add each service with description and pricing (if applicable).

6_09_gbp_qna.check: Q&A section has pre-populated questions and answers
6_09_gbp_qna.how_to_fix: Add common questions and answer them yourself to control the narrative.

6_10_gbp_website_link.check: Website URL in GBP points to correct homepage with UTM tracking

7_performance_core_web_vitals.label: Performance & Core Web Vitals
7_performance_core_web_vitals.description: Page speed, load time, and Core Web Vitals optimization.

7_01_gzip_compression.check: GZIP/Brotli compression enabled for HTML, CSS, JS, JSON, SVG
7_01_gzip_compression.how_to_fix: Add mod_deflate rules in .htaccess for all text-based content types.

7_02_browser_caching.check: Browser caching headers set (images 1yr, CSS/JS 1mo, HTML 1hr)
7_02_browser_caching.how_to_fix: Add mod_expires rules in .htaccess with appropriate expiry times.

7_03_cache_control.check: Cache-Control headers set with appropriate max-age values
7_03_cache_control.how_to_fix: Add Cache-Control headers via .htaccess for different file types.

7_04_lcp_optimization.how_to_fix: Preload hero image, optimize server response, reduce render-blocking resources.

7_05_fid_optimization.how_to_fix: Defer non-critical JS, break up long tasks, use web workers.

7_06_cls_optimization.how_to_fix: Set width/height on images, avoid dynamic content injection above fold.

7_07_preload_lcp.check: LCP image is preloaded with <link rel='preload'>
7_07_preload_lcp.how_to_fix: Add <link rel='preload' href='hero.webp' as='image' type='image/webp'> in <head>.

7_08_preconnect.check: Preconnect to external origins (fonts, CDN, analytics)
7_08_preconnect.how_to_fix: Add <link rel='preconnect' href='https://fonts.googleapis.com'> for each external origin.

7_09_defer_js.check: Non-critical JavaScript is deferred or loaded async
7_09_defer_js.how_to_fix: Add defer or async attribute to <script> tags. Move scripts to end of body.

7_10_critical_css.check: Critical CSS is inlined or loaded first for above-the-fold content
7_10_critical_css.how_to_fix: Extract critical CSS and inline it in <head>. Load rest async.

7_11_font_optimization.check: Web fonts use font-display: swap to prevent FOIT
7_11_font_optimization.how_to_fix: Add &display=swap to Google Fonts URL or font-display: swap in @font-face.

7_12_etag_removal.check: ETags removed to reduce server overhead
7_12_etag_removal.how_to_fix: Add 'Header unset ETag' and 'FileETag None' in .htaccess.

7_13_minification.check: CSS and JS files are minified in production
7_13_minification.how_to_fix: Use tools like cssnano, terser, or online minifiers to minify CSS/JS.

7_14_cdn_usage.check: Static assets served via CDN (Cloudflare, BunnyCDN, etc.)
7_14_cdn_usage.how_to_fix: Set up Cloudflare (free tier) or other CDN for static assets.

8_security.label: Security
8_security.description: Website security headers and best practices.

8_01_hsts.how_to_fix: Add Header set Strict-Transport-Security 'max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains; preload' in .htaccess.

8_04_xss_protection.how_to_fix: Add Header set X-XSS-Protection '1; mode=block' in .htaccess.

8_06_permissions_policy.check: Permissions-Policy header set (restrict camera, microphone, geolocation)
8_06_permissions_policy.how_to_fix: Add Header set Permissions-Policy 'camera=(), microphone=(), geolocation=()' in .htaccess.

8_09_sensitive_files_blocked.check: Sensitive files (.env, .git, .sql, .zip, .bak) are blocked from access
8_09_sensitive_files_blocked.how_to_fix: Add FilesMatch rules in .htaccess to deny access to sensitive file extensions.

8_10_email_obfuscation.check: Email addresses are obfuscated (JS-rendered or encoded) to prevent scraping
8_10_email_obfuscation.how_to_fix: Render email via JavaScript or use HTML entity encoding.

9_local_seo.label: Local SEO
9_local_seo.description: Location-based optimization for local search visibility.

9_01_local_keywords.check: Location-specific keywords in title, meta description, H1, content
9_01_local_keywords.how_to_fix: Include city/region names naturally: 'Real Estate Marketing Agency in Delhi NCR'.

9_02_nap_on_website.check: NAP (Name, Address, Phone) visible on every page (footer)
9_02_nap_on_website.how_to_fix: Add business name, address, phone in footer of every page.

9_03_google_maps_embed.check: Google Maps embed on contact page showing business location
9_03_google_maps_embed.how_to_fix: Embed Google Maps iframe on contact page with business location.

9_04_local_citations.check: Business listed on JustDial, Sulekha, IndiaMART, Yellow Pages (if applicable)
9_04_local_citations.how_to_fix: Submit business to relevant local directories with consistent NAP.

9_05_geo_coordinates.check: Geo coordinates in LocalBusiness schema match actual location
9_05_geo_coordinates.how_to_fix: Add correct latitude/longitude in LocalBusiness schema geo property.

9_06_service_area.check: Service area defined in schema and content
9_06_service_area.how_to_fix: Add areaServed property in schema. Mention service areas in content.

10_content_strategy.label: Content Strategy & Blog SEO
10_content_strategy.description: Content marketing and blog optimization for organic traffic growth.

10_01_blog_exists.check: Blog/insights section exists with regular content (at least 4 posts)
10_01_blog_exists.how_to_fix: Create blog section with keyword-targeted articles. Publish 2-4 per month.

10_02_blog_seo.check: Each blog post has unique title, meta description, OG tags, Article schema
10_02_blog_seo.how_to_fix: Optimize each post: title tag, meta desc, H1, OG image, Article JSON-LD.

10_03_blog_internal_links.check: Blog posts interlink with each other and with service pages
10_03_blog_internal_links.how_to_fix: Add 2-3 internal links per blog post to related posts and service pages.

10_04_blog_categories.check: Blog posts are organized by categories/topics
10_04_blog_categories.how_to_fix: Create category pages or tag system for blog organization.

10_05_evergreen_content.check: Mix of evergreen (timeless) and trending (timely) content
10_05_evergreen_content.how_to_fix: Create pillar content (guides, how-tos) alongside news and updates.

10_06_content_calendar.check: Content calendar exists with planned topics for next 3 months
10_06_content_calendar.how_to_fix: Plan topics based on keyword research. Schedule 2-4 posts per month.

10_07_featured_snippets.check: Content formatted to win featured snippets (lists, tables, definitions, how-tos)
10_07_featured_snippets.how_to_fix: Use numbered lists, tables, Q&A format, and direct answer paragraphs.

11_ux_cro.label: UX & Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO)
11_ux_cro.description: User experience and conversion optimization checks.

11_01_cta_visibility.check: Clear CTAs above the fold on every page (button, form, or link)
11_01_cta_visibility.how_to_fix: Place primary CTA button in hero section. Use contrasting colors.

11_02_cta_text.check: CTA text is action-oriented ('Get Free Audit' not 'Submit')
11_02_cta_text.how_to_fix: Use benefit-driven CTA text: 'Start Generating Leads', 'Get Free Quote'.

11_03_contact_form.check: Contact form has minimal fields (name, phone, email minimum)
11_03_contact_form.how_to_fix: Keep forms short: 3-5 fields max. More fields = lower conversion.

11_04_phone_clickable.check: Phone numbers are clickable (tel: link) on mobile

11_05_whatsapp_button.check: WhatsApp floating button present for instant contact
11_05_whatsapp_button.how_to_fix: Add fixed-position WhatsApp button linking to wa.me/number.

11_06_trust_signals.check: Trust signals visible (reviews, ratings, client logos, certifications)
11_06_trust_signals.how_to_fix: Add Google rating, client logos, testimonials, case study numbers.

11_07_social_proof.check: Testimonials/reviews with real names and company names
11_07_social_proof.how_to_fix: Add 3+ testimonials with full name, designation, company, and photo/initials.

11_08_exit_intent.check: Exit intent popup with lead magnet (free audit, guide, consultation)
11_08_exit_intent.how_to_fix: Add JS-triggered popup on mouse exit with compelling offer.

11_09_cookie_consent.check: Cookie consent banner present and functional
11_09_cookie_consent.how_to_fix: Add cookie banner with Accept button and link to privacy policy.

11_10_navigation.check: Navigation is clear, consistent, and accessible on all pages
11_10_navigation.how_to_fix: Use consistent nav across all pages. Highlight current page. Mobile hamburger menu.

11_11_mobile_ux.check: Touch targets are 48px+ on mobile. No horizontal scroll.
11_11_mobile_ux.how_to_fix: Ensure buttons are 48x48px minimum. Test on real mobile devices.

11_12_thank_you_page.check: Form submission redirects to thank-you page (for conversion tracking)
11_12_thank_you_page.how_to_fix: Create thankyou.html page. Redirect form submission to it for GA conversion tracking.

11_13_above_fold_content.check: Above-the-fold content communicates value proposition clearly within 3 seconds
11_13_above_fold_content.how_to_fix: Hero section should have: clear headline, sub-headline, CTA, and trust signal.

12_analytics_tracking.label: Analytics & Tracking
12_analytics_tracking.description: Analytics setup for data-driven decision making.

12_01_ga4_installed.check: Google Analytics 4 (GA4) is installed and tracking
12_01_ga4_installed.how_to_fix: Create GA4 property. Add gtag.js or GTM container to all pages.

12_02_gtm_installed.check: Google Tag Manager is installed for easy tag management
12_02_gtm_installed.how_to_fix: Create GTM container. Add GTM snippet to <head> and <body> of all pages.

12_03_conversion_tracking.check: Form submissions tracked as conversions in GA4
12_03_conversion_tracking.how_to_fix: Set up conversion event in GA4 for form submit or thank-you page visit.

12_04_phone_call_tracking.check: Phone call clicks tracked as events
12_04_phone_call_tracking.how_to_fix: Add GA4 event tracking on tel: link clicks via GTM or gtag.

12_05_whatsapp_tracking.check: WhatsApp button clicks tracked as events
12_05_whatsapp_tracking.how_to_fix: Add click event tracking on WhatsApp button via GTM.

12_06_facebook_pixel.check: Facebook/Meta Pixel installed for retargeting (if running Meta ads)
12_06_facebook_pixel.how_to_fix: Install Meta Pixel base code. Set up Lead, Contact, PageView events.

12_07_google_ads_tag.check: Google Ads conversion tag installed (if running Google Ads)
12_07_google_ads_tag.how_to_fix: Add Google Ads global site tag and conversion tracking on thank-you page.

12_08_utm_parameters.check: All external links (ads, social, email) use UTM parameters for tracking
12_08_utm_parameters.how_to_fix: Use Google Campaign URL Builder to create UTM-tagged URLs for all campaigns.

13_aeo_ai_readiness.label: Answer Engine Optimization (AEO) & AI Readiness
13_aeo_ai_readiness.description: Optimization for AI answer engines (ChatGPT, Google SGE/AI Overviews, Perplexity).

13_01_question_format_content.check: Content uses question-answer format (What, How, Why, When) for AI extraction
13_01_question_format_content.how_to_fix: Structure content as Q&A. Use H2/H3 as questions, answer in following paragraph.

13_02_concise_answers.check: Direct, concise answers (40-60 words) after each question heading
13_02_concise_answers.how_to_fix: Start answer paragraphs with direct, factual answers. Follow with elaboration.

13_03_entity_clarity.check: Brand/business is clearly defined as an entity (who, what, where, since when)
13_03_entity_clarity.how_to_fix: State clearly: 'LeadHorizon is a real estate digital marketing agency in Delhi NCR founded in XXXX.'

13_04_data_citations.check: Content includes specific numbers, stats, and data points (AI loves citing these)
13_04_data_citations.how_to_fix: Add specific metrics: '250+ projects', '80% lead qualification rate', exact numbers.

13_05_topical_authority.check: Site has 5+ pages covering related subtopics (topical cluster for authority)
13_05_topical_authority.how_to_fix: Create pillar page + 5-10 supporting pages on subtopics within your niche.

13_06_about_page.check: Detailed About page exists with team info, history, credentials (E-E-A-T)
13_06_about_page.how_to_fix: Create About page with founder info, company history, credentials, awards.

13_07_author_profiles.check: Blog posts have author names with bio (for E-E-A-T signals)
13_07_author_profiles.how_to_fix: Add author name, photo, bio, and expertise to each blog post.

13_08_llms_txt.check: llms.txt file exists (optional, emerging standard for AI crawlers)
13_08_llms_txt.how_to_fix: Create /llms.txt with structured business info for AI agents to reference.

14_off_page_seo.label: Off-Page SEO & Link Building
14_off_page_seo.description: External signals: backlinks, citations, social presence.

14_01_backlink_profile.check: Site has quality backlinks from relevant, authoritative domains
14_01_backlink_profile.how_to_fix: Guest posting, PR, directory submissions, partnerships for quality backlinks.

14_02_social_profiles.check: Active social media profiles linked from website (Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, Twitter)
14_02_social_profiles.how_to_fix: Create/optimize social profiles. Add links in footer and schema sameAs.

14_03_directory_listings.check: Business listed on relevant industry directories with consistent NAP
14_03_directory_listings.how_to_fix: Submit to industry-specific directories, local business directories.

14_04_brand_mentions.check: Brand is mentioned on external websites (even without links)
14_04_brand_mentions.how_to_fix: PR outreach, guest articles, industry publications for brand mentions.

14_05_competitor_backlinks.check: Analyzed competitor backlink profiles for link opportunities
14_05_competitor_backlinks.how_to_fix: Use Ahrefs/SEMrush to find competitor backlinks. Target same sources.

15_accessibility.label: Accessibility (a11y)
15_accessibility.description: Web accessibility checks for WCAG compliance and SEO benefit.

15_01_aria_labels.check: Interactive elements (buttons, links, icons) have aria-labels
15_01_aria_labels.how_to_fix: Add aria-label='Menu' to icon buttons, aria-label='Facebook' to social icons.

15_02_color_contrast.check: Text has sufficient color contrast (WCAG AA: 4.5:1 for body text)
15_02_color_contrast.how_to_fix: Check with WebAIM Contrast Checker. Adjust text/background colors.

15_03_keyboard_navigation.check: Site is fully navigable via keyboard (Tab, Enter, Escape)
15_03_keyboard_navigation.how_to_fix: Ensure focus styles visible, modal traps focus, all interactive elements focusable.

15_04_form_labels.check: All form inputs have associated <label> elements
15_04_form_labels.how_to_fix: Add <label for='fieldId'> for every input, or use aria-label.

15_05_skip_navigation.check: Skip to main content link exists for screen readers
15_05_skip_navigation.how_to_fix: Add hidden 'Skip to main content' link at top of page.

15_06_semantic_html.check: Uses semantic HTML5 elements (header, nav, main, section, article, footer)
15_06_semantic_html.how_to_fix: Replace generic divs with semantic elements where appropriate.

16_01_privacy_policy.check: Privacy Policy page exists with data collection and usage details
16_01_privacy_policy.how_to_fix: Create privacy-policy.html covering data collection, cookies, third-party sharing.

16_02_terms_of_service.how_to_fix: Create terms.html with usage terms, disclaimers, liability limitations.

16_03_cookie_policy.check: Cookie policy disclosed (can be part of privacy policy)
16_03_cookie_policy.how_to_fix: Add cookie usage section in privacy policy or create separate cookie-policy.html.

16_04_copyright_notice.check: Copyright notice in footer with current year
16_04_copyright_notice.how_to_fix: Add © [Current Year] Brand Name in footer. Update annually.

16_05_gdpr_compliance.check: GDPR/data protection compliance if serving EU users
16_05_gdpr_compliance.how_to_fix: Add consent mechanism for cookies, data processing disclosure.

execution_instructions.label: How to Use This Checklist with AI
execution_instructions.description: Instructions for AI agents to execute this checklist on any website URL.
steps: 1. User provides a website URL.
2. AI fetches the URL and all linked pages (homepage, about, services, blog, contact, privacy, terms).
3. AI reads robots.txt, sitemap.xml from the domain.
4. AI checks each item in this checklist against the fetched content.
5. AI sets status for each item: done, missing, partial, over_optimized, or not_applicable.
6. AI generates a prioritized fix list (critical first, then high, medium, low).
7. AI auto-fixes what it can (HTML edits, schema additions, meta tags, htaccess).
8. AI generates report with before/after comparison.
9. AI uploads fixed files to server if access is available.
10. AI re-submits sitemap and requests indexing via GSC API if connected.
auto_fixable_items: Open Graph and Twitter Card tags
